item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, January 10, 2025 at 3:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Announcing Rust 1.84.0 (51 points | 7 comments)
2. Not every user owns an iPhone (29 points | 32 comments)
3. Northeastern’s redesign of the Khoury curriculum abandons the fundamentals of computer science (18 points | 39 comments)
4. 16GB Raspberry Pi 5 available now (30 points | 21 comments)
5. A Pixel Parable (15 points | 4 comments)
6. Alloy 6.2.0 released (7 points | no comments)
7. dnsclay: DNS UPDATE/AXFR/NOTIFY to many custom DNS operator APIs gateway (3 points | 7 comments)
8. IP-over-Toslink (8 points | 2 comments)
9. UK Users: Lobsters needs your help with the Online Safety Act (320 points | 150 comments)
10. broccoli: A robust message queue system for Rust applications, designed as a Rust alternative to Celery (36 points | 11 comments)
11. Google & Linux Foundation Launch "Supporters of Chromium-Based Browsers" Fund (5 points | 2 comments)
12. End-to-end testing emails (4 points | 1 comment)
13. Pushing the whole company into the past on purpose (3 points | no comments)
14. Can LLMs write better code if you keep asking them to “write better code”? (4 points | no comments)
15. Some Programming Language Ideas (41 points | 23 comments)
16. WorstFit: Unveiling Hidden Transformers in Windows ANSI (5 points | no comments)
17. Process creation in io_uring (11 points | 1 comment)
18. Name Collision of the Year: Vector (10 points | 2 comments)
19. Go is a Well-Designed Language, Actually (33 points | 94 comments)
20. A simple trick to understand Ruby’s lazy enumerator (8 points | no comments)
21. How Britain got its first internet connection (2 points | no comments)
22. Shaping Ligatures in Monospace Fonts (1 points | no comments)
23. Bringing SerenityOS to real hardware, one driver at a time (47 points | 4 comments)
24. Why isn't `__attribute__((cleanup(...)))` more known? (1 points | no comments)
25. SQLite Archive Files (36 points | 19 comments)
